transcription: [00:00.000] Take soaked rice and urad dal and grind them into a smooth batter.
[00:10.000] Mix well and let the batter ferment overnight or for 8 hours.
[00:20.000] Once fermented, check the consistency; add water if needed to get idli batter consistency.
[00:30.000] Heat the paniyaram pan and lightly grease each mold with oil or ghee.
[00:40.000] Pour a spoonful of batter into each mold, filling about 3/4th.
[00:50.000] Cover the pan with a lid and cook on medium heat for 5-6 minutes.
[01:00.000] Check the bottom for golden brown color, then flip carefully to cook the other side.
[01:10.000] Cook for another 3-4 minutes till both sides are golden and cooked through.
[01:20.000] Remove from the pan and serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.
[01:30.000] Enjoy soft and delicious mini idlis, also called paddus.
